meanings.definition: The continuous movement of blood through the heart and blood vessels.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how important circulations are for our health.
meanings.sent2: The circulations in our body ensure oxygen reaches all our organs.
meanings.sent3: During the race, the tortoise challenged the hare to a circulations contest.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness flowed through the room like circulations in a river.
meanings.sent5: The circulations of the heart keep us alive and well.

meanings.definition: The passing around of something from person to person.
meanings.sent1: The circulations of the rumor quickly spread throughout the school.
meanings.sent2: The circulations of the petition gathered many signatures.
meanings.sent3: The circulations of the joke made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The circulations of the secret were hard to control.
meanings.sent5: The circulations of kindness can make a big difference.

meanings.definition: The distribution of newspapers, magazines, or other publications.
meanings.sent1: The circulations of the newspaper increased after the headline.
meanings.sent2: The circulations of the magazine reached households nationwide.
meanings.sent3: The circulations of the comic book surprised the artist.
meanings.sent4: The circulations of the flyer caught the attention of many.
meanings.sent5: The circulations of information are crucial in journalism.

meanings.definition: The flow of air or water in a closed system.
meanings.sent1: The circulations in the aquarium kept the water clean.
meanings.sent2: The circulations in the ventilation system kept the room cool.
meanings.sent3: The circulations in the bubble machine delighted the children.
meanings.sent4: The circulations in the wind tunnel were carefully monitored.
meanings.sent5: The circulations in the closed loop ensured efficiency.
